alert.note: Alert for Madison (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 25 at 1:00AM CDT until March 25 at 1:30AM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 AM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN MARSHALL AND SOUTHEASTERN MADISON COUNTIES... At 1259 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Owens Cross Roads, or 11 miles southeast of Redstone Arsenal, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This dangerous storm will be near... Grant around 120 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Columbus City and Union Grove. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
